summary.span: Asynchronously closes the object.

span.span: Asynchronously closes the object.

returns.span: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

span.span: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此异步方法的默认实现将委托给其同步对应项，并返回已完成的 `Task`，这可能会阻止调用线程。The default implementation of this asynchronous method delegates to its synchronous counterpart and returns a completed `Task`, potentially blocking the calling thread. 支持[异步编程](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md)的数据访问接口应使用异步 i/o 操作来重写默认实现。Data providers that support [asynchronous programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md) should override the default implementation using asynchronous I/O operations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed
abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit

summary.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用完 后，调用 `Dispose` 或 `DisposeAsync`。Call `Dispose` or `DisposeAsync` when you've finished using the . 调用其中一种方法会使 处于不可用状态。Calling one of these methods leaves the in an unusable state. 释放后，必须释放对 的所有引用，以便垃圾回收器可以回收 占用的内存。After disposing, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息，请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 在释放对 的最后一个引用之前，始终释放。Always dispose before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.

span.span: ADO.NET Overview

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用完 后，调用 `Dispose` 或 `DisposeAsync`。Call `Dispose` or `DisposeAsync` when you've finished using the . 调用其中一种方法会使 处于不可用状态。Calling one of these methods leaves the in an unusable state. 释放后，必须释放对 的所有引用，以便垃圾回收器可以回收 占用的内存。After disposing, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息，请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 在释放对 的最后一个引用之前，始终释放。Always dispose before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method. 此异步方法的默认实现将委托给其同步对应项，并返回已完成的 `ValueTask`，这可能会阻止调用线程。The default implementation of this asynchronous method delegates to its synchronous counterpart and returns a completed `ValueTask`, potentially blocking the calling thread. 支持[异步编程](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md)的数据访问接口应使用异步 i/o 操作来重写默认实现。Data providers that support [asynchronous programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md) should override the default implementation using asynchronous I/O operations.

summary.span: When overridden in a derived class, returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the rows in the data reader.

span.span: An enumerator that can be used to iterate through the rows in the data reader.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管可以使用此方法来检索显式构造函数，但在支持显式**foreach**构造的语言中，直接使用循环构造来循环访问数据读取器中的行更为简单。Although you can use this method to retrieve an explicit constructor, in languages that support an explicit **foreach** construct, it is simpler to use the looping construct directly in order to iterate through the rows in the data reader. 如果实现此方法，则它应返回 的新实例，或确保枚举器返回 对象。If you implement this method, it should return a new instance of or ensure that your enumerator returns objects.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<!!T> GetFieldValueAsync<T>(int32 ordinal) cil managed
Public Function GetFieldValueAsync(Of T) (ordinal As Integer) As Task(Of T)

span.span: The type of the value to be returned.
The zero-based column ordinal.

summary.span: Asynchronously gets the value of the specified column as the requested type.

span.span: Asynchronously gets the value of the specified column as the requested type.

returns.span: A task whose contains the value of the specified column.

span.span: A task whose contains the value of the specified column.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 仅当在顺序模式下创建读取器时，才需要此异步方法来避免阻塞调用线程。This asynchronous method is only needed to avoid blocking the calling thread when the reader is created in sequential mode. 如果未指定顺序模式，则每次 ReadAsync 完成时，所有列值都将在内存中可用，并且调用该方法的同步版本不应阻止调用线程。If sequential mode isn't specified, all column values should become available in memory each time ReadAsync completes, and calling the synchronous version of the method shouldn't block the calling thread. 此异步方法的默认实现调用其同步对应项，并返回已完成的任务，可能会阻止调用线程。The default implementation of this asynchronous method invokes its synchronous counterpart and returns a completed Task, potentially blocking the calling thread. 支持[异步编程](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md)的数据访问接口应使用异步 i/o 操作来重写默认实现。Data providers that support [asynchronous programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md) should override the default implementation using asynchronous I/O operations. 当返回任务还未完成时， DbDataReader 对象的其他方法和属性不应调用 。Other methods and properties of the DbDataReader object should not be invoked while the returned Task is not yet completed.

abstract member GetFieldValueAsync : int * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<'T> override this.GetFieldValueAsync : int * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<'T>

The zero-based column ordinal.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.span: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.

span.span: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.

span.span: Asynchronously gets the value of the specified column as the requested type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 仅当在顺序模式下创建读取器时，才需要此异步方法来避免阻塞调用线程。This asynchronous method is only needed to avoid blocking the calling thread when the reader is created in sequential mode. 如果未指定顺序模式，则每次 ReadAsync 完成时，所有列值都将在内存中可用，并且调用该方法的同步版本不应阻止调用线程。If sequential mode isn't specified, all column values should become available in memory each time ReadAsync completes, and calling the synchronous version of the method shouldn't block the calling thread. 此异步方法的默认实现调用其同步对应项，并返回已完成的任务，可能会阻止调用线程。The default implementation of this asynchronous method invokes its synchronous counterpart and returns a completed Task, potentially blocking the calling thread. 如果传递了已取消的取消标记，则默认实现还会返回已取消的任务。The default implementation also returns a cancelled task if passed an already cancelled cancellation token. 支持[异步编程](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md)的数据访问接口应使用异步 i/o 操作来重写默认实现。Data providers that support [asynchronous programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md) should override the default implementation using asynchronous I/O operations. 此方法接受可用于请求提前取消操作的取消标记。This method accepts a cancellation token that can be used to request the operation to be cancelled early. 实现可能会忽略此请求。Implementations may ignore this request. 当返回任务还未完成时， DbDataReader 对象的其他方法和属性不应调用 。Other methods and properties of the DbDataReader object should not be invoked while the returned Task is not yet completed.

exception.span: The connection was dropped or closed during data retrieval.

span.span: The connection was dropped or closed during data retrieval.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法可在调用类型化 Get_ \* _ 方法之前（例如 、等）检查是否有空列值，以避免引发异常。Call this method to check for null column values before calling the typed Get_\*_ methods (for example, , , and so on) to avoid throwing an exception.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> IsDBNullAsync(int32 ordinal) cil managed
Public Function IsDBNullAsync (ordinal As Integer) As Task(Of Boolean)

remarks.format: ## Remarks 仅当在顺序模式下创建读取器时，才需要此异步方法来避免阻塞调用线程。This asynchronous method is only needed to avoid blocking the calling thread when the reader is created in sequential mode. 如果未指定顺序模式，则每次 ReadAsync 完成时，所有列值都将在内存中可用，并且调用该方法的同步版本不应阻止调用线程。If sequential mode isn't specified, all column values should become available in memory each time ReadAsync completes, and calling the synchronous version of the method shouldn't block the calling thread. 此异步方法的默认实现调用其同步对应项，并返回已完成的任务，可能会阻止调用线程。The default implementation of this asynchronous method invokes its synchronous counterpart and returns a completed Task, potentially blocking the calling thread. 支持[异步编程](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md)的数据访问接口应使用异步 i/o 操作来重写默认实现。Data providers that support [asynchronous programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md) should override the default implementation using asynchronous I/O operations. 当返回任务还未完成时， DbDataReader 对象的其他方法和属性不应调用 。Other methods and properties of the DbDataReader object should not be invoked while the returned Task is not yet completed.

param.span: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 仅当在顺序模式下创建读取器时，才需要此异步方法来避免阻塞调用线程。This asynchronous method is only needed to avoid blocking the calling thread when the reader is created in sequential mode. 如果未指定顺序模式，则每次 ReadAsync 完成时，所有列值都将在内存中可用，并且调用该方法的同步版本不应阻止调用线程。If sequential mode isn't specified, all column values should become available in memory each time ReadAsync completes, and calling the synchronous version of the method shouldn't block the calling thread. 此异步方法的默认实现调用其同步对应项，并返回已完成的任务，可能会阻止调用线程。The default implementation of this asynchronous method invokes its synchronous counterpart and returns a completed Task, potentially blocking the calling thread. 如果传递了已取消的取消标记，则默认实现还会返回已取消的任务。The default implementation also returns a cancelled task if passed an already cancelled cancellation token. 支持[异步编程](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md)的数据访问接口应使用异步 i/o 操作来重写默认实现。Data providers that support [asynchronous programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md) should override the default implementation using asynchronous I/O operations. 此方法接受可用于请求提前取消操作的取消标记。This method accepts a cancellation token that can be used to request the operation to be cancelled early. 实现可能会忽略此请求。Implementations may ignore this request. 当返回任务还未完成时， DbDataReader 对象的其他方法和属性不应调用 。Other methods and properties of the DbDataReader object should not be invoked while the returned Task is not yet completed.

span.span: A task whose property is if there are more result sets or if there aren't.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此异步方法的默认实现调用其同步对应项，并返回已完成的任务，可能会阻止调用线程。The default implementation of this asynchronous method invokes its synchronous counterpart and returns a completed Task, potentially blocking the calling thread. 支持[异步编程](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md)的数据访问接口应使用异步 i/o 操作来重写默认实现。Data providers that support [asynchronous programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md) should override the default implementation using asynchronous I/O operations. 当返回任务还未完成时， DbDataReader 对象的其他方法和属性不应调用 。Other methods and properties of the DbDataReader object should not be invoked while the returned Task is not yet completed.

exception.span: An error occurred while executing the command text.

span.span: An error occurred while executing the command text.
ADO.NET Overview

abstract member NextResultAsync : System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool> override this.NextResultAsync : System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool>

span.span: The cancellation instruction.

summary.span: Asynchronously advances the reader to the next result when reading the results of a batch of statements.

span.span: Asynchronously advances the reader to the next result when reading the results of a batch of statements.

returns.span: A whose property is if there are more result sets or if there aren't.

span.span: A whose property is if there are more result sets or if there aren't.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此异步方法的默认实现调用其同步对应项，并返回已完成的任务，可能会阻止调用线程。The default implementation of this asynchronous method invokes its synchronous counterpart and returns a completed Task, potentially blocking the calling thread. 如果传递了已取消的取消标记，则默认实现还会返回已取消的任务。The default implementation also returns a cancelled task if passed an already cancelled cancellation token. 支持[异步编程](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md)的数据访问接口应使用异步 i/o 操作来重写默认实现。Data providers that support [asynchronous programming](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/asynchronous-programming.md) should override the default implementation using asynchronous I/O operations. 此方法接受可用于请求提前取消操作的取消标记。This method accepts a cancellation token that can be used to request the operation to be cancelled early. 实现可能会忽略此请求。Implementations may ignore this request. 当返回任务还未完成时， DbDataReader 对象的其他方法和属性不应调用 。Other methods and properties of the DbDataReader object should not be invoked while the returned Task is not yet completed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 数据读取器的默认位置处于第一条记录之前。The default position of a data reader is before the first record. 因此，必须调用 才能开始访问数据。Therefore, you must call to begin accessing data.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property RecordsAffected As Integer
public: abstract property int RecordsAffected { int get(); };

summary.span: When overridden in a derived class, gets the number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted by execution of the SQL statement.

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, gets the number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted by execution of the SQL statement.

value.span: 更改、插入或删除的行数。

span.span: The number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted.

value.span: 对于 SELECT 语句为-1;如果没有受影响的行或语句失败，则为0。

span.span: -1 for SELECT statements; 0 if no rows were affected or the statement failed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在读取所有行并关闭 `DataReader`之前，不会设置 `RecordsAffected` 属性。The `RecordsAffected` property is not set until all rows are read and you close the `DataReader`.

para.span: 此属性和 应实现为，以便在读取器关闭时返回值。

span.span: This property and should be implemented to return a value when the reader is closed.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property VisibleFieldCount As Integer
public: virtual property int VisibleFieldCount { int get(); };

summary.span: Gets the number of fields in the that are not hidden.

span.span: Gets the number of fields in the that are not hidden.
The number of fields that are not hidden.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此值用于确定 中的可见字段的数目。This value is used to determine how many fields in the are visible. 例如，对分部主键执行 SELECT 将以隐藏字段的形式返回该键的其余部分。For example, a SELECT on a partial primary key returns the remaining parts of the key as hidden fields. 隐藏的字段始终追加在可见字段之后。The hidden fields are always appended behind the visible fields.

span.span: ADO.NET Overview
